snippet: Iran’s new foreign minister, an American-educated diplomat, was assigned responsibility on Thursday for leading negotiations over the nation’s disputed nuclear program.
abstract: Iranian Foreign Min Mohammad Javad Zarif, American-educated diplomat, is officially assigned responsibility for leading negotiations over nation's disputed nuclear program; move is another signal the country seems eager to overcome impasses that have stalled those talks for years.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and ROBERT MACKEY
byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Iran’s new foreign minister, an American-educated diplomat, was assigned responsibility on Thursday for leading negotiations over the nation’s disputed nuclear program.

headline.main: Iran Signals an Eagerness to Overcome Old Impasses
headline.print_headline: Iran Signals An Eagerness To Overcome Old Impasses
